intro: Psammogeton setifolius, commonly known as the silky sandburs, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its slender, spiny seed pods that mature into the distinctive burrs that give the plant its common name. The plant typically grows from 30 to 100 centimeters tall, with linear, grass-like leaves that are covered in fine, silky hairs. Its flowers are small and inconspicuous, usually green or pale yellow, and appear in clusters at the base of the plant. Psammogeton setifolius is adapted to thrive in sandy soils and is often found in disturbed or open habitats.
